revised_title: PKC Regulation of Slow Na Current in Xenopus Oocytes
tldr: The study investigates the role of protein kinase C (PKC) in the regulation of slow Na current in Xenopus oocytes. Results show that PKC activation enhances the Na current amplitude, while PKC inhibitors decrease the inward current, suggesting that PKC phosphorylation is a crucial step in Na channel induction.
